data.title: Dinner at the Old Hotel Bistro
data.text: The dining area was nicely decorated.  I had a chicken dish and my husband ordered the meatloaf.  The food is definitely comfort food. The corn chowder was worth trying.  What surprised us the most was that the waitress did not know the menu very well. We asked for house made dressing, but she said they didn't make their own dressing for salad. We had to point out to her that the menu stated otherwise. She had to ask the chef if this was the case.  There are several sauces that come with certain entrees, such as the one on my chicken.  When I asked her what it was, she gave me the wrong information, it was completely different than what I was told. At one point she had to ask the chef what one item on the menu was. It didn't make a very good impression.  Overall the food was fair.  From reviewing their website we expected much more than what the meals actually were.  We will not try this restaurant again.

data.title: worst service ever
data.text: food is very good if you can ever get waited on properly. Fresh, local, well prepared dinners but, service caused us too leave before we ordered on our last visit.

data.title: Wedding Shower
data.text: I attended a wedding shower luncheon & it was a very nice event.  Our servers were very attentive & kept our water, tea, coffee cups full at all times.  The food was a great variety of finger foods, salad & quiche.  We all were satisfied and full from our meal.  I would recommend this location for private parties.

data.title: Good food & dessert
data.text: Good food & dessert and a great atmosphere, plus wonderful and attentive staff. I had salmon and apple pie and both were very delicious.

data.title: Great food and atmosphere
data.text: Love this restaurant great for a mother/daughter lunch or with friends.  The food is great and the teas are out of this world.  It has a great tea house atmosphere.  And the staff is good.  They have a small boutique in the front that is fun to go through.  They also do wedding receptions.

data.title: Hidden gem
data.text: I've been there several times with family and friends for brunch.  Tea and scones are a must! Variety of different foods all great!  I  haven't been able to try dinner here however my sister said it was excellent. Feels like a true English tea house and yes real tea cups. Reservations recommended.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Excellent food New Orleans style the chef actually can to make sure we were enjoying our meal and invited our dog to join us on the outside patio. So many impressed great level of service, pet friendly and dessert out of this world.

data.title: Authentic New Orleans cuisine in the heart of old town  Clovis CA
data.text: What a wonderful surprise to find authentic New Orleans cuisine in the heart of old town Clovis, CA! Chef Jim's rich flavorful gumbo sported a dark roux that my mother would be proud of....the shrimp and grits were also great and the bread pudding was the best I have had outside of New Orleans! The warm attentive service I received from Ambi  was exceptional and the historical attributes of the Old Hotel Bistro provided a suitable ambience for this memorable meal.

data.title: Take Me Back Titanic
data.text: We've been wanting to try this place since they opened so we went for lunch.  The building is cool (outside) and rich with history.  The front entrance is a gift shop and the dining is sectioned off into three large rooms.  The restaurant decor is very vintage like what you would see on the Titanic.  And the guest easily average 65+ years of age.  We were the youngest, hippest couple by far.  Now the food was surprisingly good.  We had the French dip and salmon salad, and tried the bread pudding.   The tea was excellent.  We won't go back because of the ambiance.  Take the food and put it in a different space, then perhaps we would dine again.  Service was good and menu is limited to salad, sandwiches, and a couple of soups.

data.title: Nice Place For Lunch
data.text: First time eating at The Old Hotel Bistro and enjoyed having lunch on the front porch. The portions were very big (I ordered the Club Sandwich and took half of it home). The potato salad was delicious. They also offer beignets which were very good and reasonably priced. A definite restaurant to add to your list of places to eat while in Clovis.

data.title: Unique fine dining
data.text: This is a very quaint place with a limited but divine menu. Decadent is the perfect word to describe the food.They have a large wine and beer list as well as many delicious non-alcoholic beverages available.

data.title: Great hidden gem in downtown
data.text: Had a great meal, and even better service on a Friday night. Was so impressed am taking another couple this weekend. Started with a southern spicy gumbo and then had a very unique meatloaf and was very happy. Bread pudding for dessert was fantastic. Price was reasonable. Highly recommend for couples early night out. Great turn of the century atmosphere and décor in the back dining area is even more fun.

data.title: Interesting
data.text: We had very good service and the food was good, though not quite what I was expecting.  This is a charming building serving a limited menu based around French/creole items.  Prices were reasonable.

data.title: Wonderful place for a meal on a fall afternoon
data.text:
We had great service from a super friendly and welcoming staff, so not sure what was going on in some of the other reviews.  The setting is so beautiful as we really enjoyed a leisurely lunch out on the front porch of this wonderful building.  So peaceful feeling the fall breeze, seeing leaves drifting off the trees, and people watching.  
The food was good as well.  One of us had the Burger which was okay but it had a strange tasting seasoning and even though we ordered it done medium it was served well done so kind of dry.  The buns though are delicious as they are buttered and toasted.  The other meal was a chef salad which was beautifully presented and served with an excellent balsamic vinaigrette.  They have a large selections of teas as well as coffees beer and wine.  All in all I would definitely go back.

data.title: I really wanted to like it.....:(
data.text: I love Old Town Clovis and this beautiful Victorian home but the food was not good. We sent back our fish tacos and although the chef gave us a free glass of wine he still charged us for the tacos which I thought was poor service. We enjoyed the atmosphere and sitting on the porch but I hate to say we won't be back.

data.title: Is anyone home?
data.text: I didn't think the restaurant was open as we waited and waited for someone to seat us.  It was dark inside and no one else was there at lunch time.  Eventually someone came.  The food was mediocre and I felt I was imposing on the staff.

data.title: Wonderful hint of history
data.text: This building reeks of history!  This is a good thing as I am a history lover!  The beauty of the inside of this store/restaurant is above the mark.  I have dined here several times and am always amazed with the concoctions they come up with.

data.title: Delicious dinner with a Bread Pudding finish!
data.text:
We tried this Spot one night on a whim and happily accepted the patio (well, it's a long porch...) seating because the April night was lovely.   A little earlier in the evening would be a great place for people watching in Old Town but we were there just before closing time. Also, some Person pulled a big RV RIGHT UP TO THE FRONT PARKING SPACE RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE RESTAURANT--left the loud motor running for 30 minutes!
In spite of that, we had a nice dinner and we're pleased with both food and service. My guy enjoyed the meatloaf and I liked the bourbon chicken. We ordered the Whiskey Bread Pudding to go and it was delicious!  I spent a few minutes talking to the chef and he very kindly gave me a little tour of the inside restaurant including the extra space behind the drapes. I thought it was pretty nice of them to take the time since they were closed and trying to clean up. 
I've driven past the Old Clovis Hotel Bistro several times but thought it was just a gift shop. I found it on Yelp or we wouldn't have thought to eat there. If I were to make one suggestion it would be to create A more distinct entrance past the gift area That lets the casual visitor know there's a restaurant. Perhaps a more modern New Orleans Decor that would create a better backdrop for the fine menu??

data.title: Pretty Setting but Major service Issues...
data.text: Was brought here for my Birthday. Lovely front patio table, but they were so understaffed it marred the experience. Friendly young Waiter, but huge stretches of time between order of drinks, order of food, delivery etc. So much time elapsed I never got my Bday dessert that was preordered either. But Think he was the only server that day. He made a production about singing & never did or mentioned again. Very disappointing ! And not particularly cheap either. Brought coffee, and when told he offered to heat in the micro! Really?? Could go on but one gets the picture. It's a SHAME. The Chicken salad is very good.

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: The menu recently changed at (the beginning of this year). This is the second time my spouse and I have been since. I cannot understand why there isn't a huge waiting list to get in. The New Orleans inspired menu is fabulous. The chef came to our table to ask how everything was, and talked about his culinary style. We have tried the steak, salmon, meat loaf and chicken. The homemade biscuits are delightful! I'm not into franchise restaurants and like to buy local. I highly recommend this hidden gem!
